name: Mid-Valley Fairy Shrimp
overview: The Mid-Valley Fairy Shrimp can reach maturity in as little as four days and reproduce in 16 days. This allows the species to survive through long periods of extreme drought. Can be seen following spring showers.
habitat: They are found in short lived vernal pools averaging 4 inches in depth. The mid-valley fairy shrimp has also been found on San Joaquin Silt Loam soils on the Riverbank formation on Low Terrace land forms.
tags: fairy shrimp vernal pool crustacean shrimp shrimps
